definition: shady relationship/affair/adulterous relationship
(of daylight) dim/obscure/clandestine/dubious
to conceal/dark
mountain pass/to close/to shut/to turn off/to concern/to involve
surname Guan
to connect/to relate to/to tie up/to bind/to be (literary)

sentences.english: Should you confess if you’ve had an affair?
sentences.chinese: 如果你曾經跟別人有曖昧關係，你是否應該坦白？

sentences.english: They have this kind of unclear relationship for some months.
sentences.chinese: 他們這種曖昧關係持續了幾個月。

sentences.english: Are you having an affair with him?
sentences.chinese: 你和他有什麼曖昧關係嗎？

sentences.english: Mr Brown and Mrs Smith have been carrying on for some months now.
sentences.chinese: 布朗先生和史密斯太太發生曖昧關係已經好幾個月了。
她的姿勢暗示了他們的曖昧關係。

sentences.english: It is also reported that he and King Philip II of France were involved.
sentences.chinese: 也有人稱，他和法國國王菲利普二世有曖昧關係。

definition: to bring trouble on oneself (idiom)
loss of love/breakup of a relationship
spendthrift and foolish/sb with more money than sense
change of affection, shift of love (idiom); to change one's feelings to another love/to fall in love with sb else
to go far/to escape to faraway places
lit. chickens flying and dogs jumping (idiom)/fig. in chaos/in disarray
paper wedding (first year wedding anniversary)
white lie
to blab/to shoot one's mouth off/to commit a gaffe
spilt water is difficult to retrieve (idiom)/it's no use crying over spilt milk/what's done is done and can't be reversed/the damage is done/once divorced, there's no reuniting
to know the score (idiom)/to be well aware of the situation
annoying/disgusting
sexual relations/sexual contact/intercourse
ability/skill
the appearance of unity, but divided at heart (idiom); seeming harmony belies underlying disagreement
to throw oneself in sb's arms/to throw oneself at sb
